The specificities concern the aetiological diagnosis with the determination of 17 OH progesterone in the context of 21 hydroxylase block. This assay has been performed systematically on blotting paper in all newborns in France since 1995 on the 3rd day of life. [Systematic newborn screening SD-308

In adrenoleukodystrophy, long-chain fatty acids are measured.

question.title: What is the specific test performed on newborns in France since 1995 to diagnose adrenal insufficiency?
question.description: A test used to determine the aetiological diagnosis of adrenal insufficiency in children

option_a.title: Blood test to measure cortisol levels
option_a.description: A test to measure the levels of cortisol in the blood

option_b.title: 17 OH progesterone assay
option_b.description: A test to determine the levels of 17 OH progesterone

option_c.title: Biopsy of the adrenal gland
option_c.description: A test to examine the adrenal gland for abnormalities

option_d.title: Genetic testing for 21 hydroxylase deficiency
option_d.description: A test to identify genetic mutations causing adrenal insufficiency

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: The first letter of the correct option
